Reviews.Title: “Very average service”
Reviews.Author: UKBMF
Reviews.Content: The only positive in staying at this hotel is its proximity to the Rome train terminus station. While that is the best part ..it also is its worst part since in italy one has to be wary of pickpockets, drunks and drug addicts near train stations.The trevi fountain, colosseum and roman ruins are at a walking distance from the hotel. At first glance, the hotel looks welcoming, but the insides have not been maintained too well. The staff are courteous but not too helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay, terrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arcmage
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff from The very beginning we're not very nice, kind of angry all the time, making a mess of the reservation. The hotel facilities were low quality, a leaking ceiling in the hallway outside the room that was making noise during the night and was not fixed for at least five days!!! Poor variety for breakfast, problems with the hot water, we could not take a shower for two while days!!! All in all, this hotel doesn't even deserve its 3 star ranking, don't come here!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zoe19950311
Reviews.Content: At first sight, it was a pretty good hotel near the center of Rome, but when we wanted to go to sleep we discovered bed bugs. There were at least six of them in our beds. We complained and got another room, but we had to split up. then the next day when we asked for our keys, the man behind the desk accused us of never having given them back. Then he discovered that the room had already been rented out to another person. We got other rooms but my friend's luggage was missing. after that we asked if they could arrange it so that we could sleep in the same room and he asked us who was supposed to do that. Apparently there was no personnel present. And all of that is just the tip of the iceberg.

Reviews.Title: “Great base from which to explore the Eternal city.”
Reviews.Author: Rocketfrogs
Reviews.Content: Situated right next to the Baths of Diocletian but in a quiet side street Hotel Fiamma is only 5 minutes walk from Termini Station. I first stayed at this Hotel in 2007 and the surrounding area was pretty seedy with loitering drunks. The area seems to be cleaned up now (especially around Termini) and the drunks have moved on. The continental breakfast is awesome and our room had a giant marble bathroom fit for Julius Caesar. All Romes major attractions are within walking distance and there are plenty of good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly reviewed- this is wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Georgiamcgrath
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when I was 15 after an exchange program & liked it so booked it to return, I am now 19 & stayed with my Nana. Maybe because I am young I appreciated it more but my Nana & I have very different expectations & she wa very happy also. After reading all these horrible reviews I was worried about what I had go us into! But once we checked in we were greeted by friendly staff & were relieved to find (a small) but very clean & cosy room with a nice bathroom. This is a 3 star hotel so dont stay here if you whinge about specks of dirt etc, too many people are like this!! Rome is an ancient city so the buildings are very old & hotel fiamma is well maintained but it's easy to see it isn't brand new. Buffet breakfast was great & free wifi 24/7 even better! 2 minute walk to termini station & underground but beautiful 20min walk thru the streets to trevi fountain, Spanish steps etc. For the price I think this is a great hotel & I am still shocked to find all these horrible reviews after my great stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs bites, cold baths, poor cleaning and bugs in coffee, don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Camilla N
Reviews.Content: Fiamma Hotel in Rome has a nice location, but thats it! The first night we got bitten by bedbugs, so we went to the reception and got another room. In the other room we also got bitten by bedbugs, and the worst thing was that we were going to bring the nasty little bugs home with us to Denmark, so we had to spray all our clothes with insecticide and our entire luggage. And when we came home we had to freeze all our stuff to be sure that no bugs were alive. That was the worst thing about Fiamma Hotel. Add to that the cleaning was very poor, there were bloodmarks on the walls from the nasty bugs, cold baths and a spider in our morning coffee! I will never go there again,

Reviews.Title: “Should have been a lot better”
Reviews.Author: lac1983
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via the Thomson website but chose to book directly as was cheaper. Was travelling for my birthday and whilst I didn't expect 5 star treatment/rooms, I did expect something functional and clean. This was sadly not the case. We stayed Friday until Monday, on the first night, we found the room not to have a window, a damp, musty smell, wall paper that was peeling, and the 'double' bed was made up of two, very uncomfortable singles pushed together at different levels. The bathroom was no better. The shower didn't sit at the top of the rail and kept falling down, and the floor of the shower was so badly drained, it flooded! The minor problem was that the TV didn't work. Anyhow, I asked that our room was changed, and having been told we would have to stay put that night, as the hotel was full, we were promised a room change the next day. This I had to chase. The second room itself seemed ok, bed was better, decor clean, and no musty smell. However, we soon discovered that the drainage wasn't much better in the shower, and it was also not at all hot, luke warm at best until the Sunday night when it eventually, became something resembling hot. This I can only put down to poor plumbing. And, the next problem - the toilet didn't work... And despite leaving our key with reception on the first night and constantly complaining asking for this to be fixed, it wasn't and we were ignored, so we ended up having to use the hotel's 3 floors down! The staff were not particularly helpful, and I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. In fact, I'll be taking the issues raised here even further.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here if you want any kind of comfort”
Reviews.Author: shazzap48
Reviews.Content: The really only good thing about this hotel is the location. We had two rooms, well one room and one cupboard. They were uncomfortable, noisy and dated although the beds were cleaner than previously reported on here. The lift was hit or miss whether it was working or not. The showers leaked and usually flooded the floor as the doors did not close properly. We could not have stayed any longer than the the 3 nights as this was enough. Came home exhausted through lack of sleep due to noise of traffic and drilling. The staff were unfriendly, unwelcoming and weren't really interested whether there were problems or not. You should not stay here if you have any kind of appetite and the breakfast was dismal.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep at Termini- less chance of being robbed”
Reviews.Content: Don't know where to start, avoid this place like the plague. Aside from the bedbugs, terrible service, overpriced and unavailable Internet, dirty mould filled rooms and awkward layouts, this place is a decent location for the price, but take one wrong turn and youre in the ghetto. I purchased internet and the password was already expired, upon asking for a new code I was accused of "using it up" though I had only just purchased it from the same guy 5 minutes prior. They take your key each time you leave the hotel, if you call this place a hotel. At which point you may get robbed, so please lock up your belongings. My roommate was robbed €150 from her money wallet the first night we stayed there. What else... Breakfast is terrible, beds are bug ridden and uncomfortable, and the place smells like smoke and mould. Good luck finding somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “There is NO "individually controlled air conditioning"”
Reviews.Author: Torig0729
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews and they reveal a similar experience that my husband and I had during our recent trip. We arrived after midnight on May 23rd, after check in we went to use the lift to get us up to the 3rd floor but it was not working. The staff could care less and we ended up having to drag our 5 pieces of luggage up the stairs with no help. We got into our room and tried to turn the air conditioning on but it was not working. Again the staff did not care and said you will have to wait till morning. The next morning we asked about the airconditioning and were told the air conditioning is not turned on and they wont turn it on for a few days. This was rather irritating because we booked the hotel after reading "individually controlled air conditioning" from Hotel Fiamma's website. We asked why it would say this if there was none but again staff did not care. We recieved a 20euro discount which was not nearly enough for being constantly uncomfortable in our room during our stay. Our room was on a very busy street and it was very loud even with the windows closed. There was construction, a garbage truck that came every night ay 2:30, and a few different busses that drove by all night. Unfortunately because we had no airconditioning we slept with the window open because it was too hot in the room. As for breakfast, there was not a very good display of food. And if you were there to late it was very picked over. And the coffee service was horrible. You had to sit at your table and wait for the staff to decided to come out to bring you coffee. One morning we sat there for 20 minutes before I found someone at the front desk and asked him to help us get some coffee. He yet again did not care and just told me to wait till they come out. They finally showed up another 10 minutes later and we had coffee. The only thing I enjoyed about this hotel was its proximity to Termini Train Station and the neighborhood was not to bad at night. But overall my experience was horrible. The level of service was dispicable, the staff did not care about anything and were completely unhelpful. I would never recomend anyone stay here, especially since there are so many other hotels around this one that may be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and dirty”
Reviews.Author: pwarne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fiamma because friends on a tight budget booked it and we wanted to be close to them during their trip to Europe. It is extremely well-located, very cheap, quiet, but that is really the end of anything positive I can say about it. I am very glad I did not read the other reviews before our trip ... at least we did not have any problem with bed bugs. Breakfast was inedible, the room was filthy, and once the air freshener wore off it revealed its true smell. All in all, it made me feel young again - it is sort of hotel I stayed in when I was a student and I felt like a break from sleeping in the station on a backpacking trip. Don't stay there unless you have to, or unless you feel like spicing up your trip to Rome with an authentic taste of the Third World. Except I have never experienced anything so bad in the Third World.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: zumzum101
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was tiny, with an overpowering smell of heating oil. This smell seemed to be on all floors however on the ground floor it was masked with airfreshener! The wardarobe fell on my head when I opened it!!! Very small and uncomfortable beds. The buffet in the morning was awfull, milk was sour, bread stale etc...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever! SERIOUSLY do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: VisitorDemo
Reviews.Content: We checked out the same night we had our check in, since it had a horrible smell (smelled mouldy). it was very dirty, especially its bathroom. The wardrobe was very dusty and the bedside table, desk and curtains looked like they might fall down if you touched them. All the furnitures in the room were very worn-out. The walls were stained and the wallpaper was peeling. The photos we saw in the internet when we booked this hotel were very different from those we saw when we got our room. I suspect that the photos showed in the internet are from Torino hotel, another hotel of this chain, which we were transferred after we complained. We requested a baby cot for our 10 months girl and they gave as another normal size bed. Anyway, we couldn’t stay there even they had a cod, since it was very unhealthy and dirty. Moreover, the toilet tank / flash wasn't working and we informed the reception about this and their reply was 'KEEP PUSHING THE BUTTON AND IT WILL WORK'! Also, we ask them for some hot water to prepare our infant milk formula and they said that we had to go to the pub in the corner! After staying in that hotel even for only 7 hours I believe all the reviews written regarding bed bugs for the specific hotel. SERIOUSLY this hotel gives a very bad image for Rome. It is by no means a 3 star, maybe it could be rated only 1star. This chain should close this hotel urgently and re-open only after they do a good refurbishment. Also, giving misleading and false photos in the internet it is considered to be fraud and illegal. Thus I strongly advise to all tourists not to stay in Fiamma.

Reviews.Title: “The best about this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: changkevin99
Reviews.Content: It is just a few minutes walk form the Termini station, which is more than conveniente. Howerver the room itself /at least the one I stayed in/ desperately calls for a reconstraction /except bathroom which was ok/. Honestly, this was a bad surprise for me. Everything looks so old and used inside/. Fortunately the staff was kind enough to make the impression better.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby small rooms - good price”
Reviews.Author: DariOlio
Reviews.Content: Price and location are the only good news re this establishment. Give a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and just what you need.”
Reviews.Author: OxfordTuffrey
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 4 night stay here and didn't know what to expect. Having never been to Rome before, not knowing about locations, distances or anything it was a bit of "pot luck". The location of the hotel is excellent, not only is it a 5 minute walk from the termini for bus, tram, metro, train, and tour bus "our chosen way to get around Rome" but there is also an excellent Italian restaurant less than 100 meters away. Don't get me wrong this isn't the ritz, far from it. But with all there is to see and do in Rome, you just need a place to sleep and relax, and a good breakfast in the morning, all this is supplied to great effect here. Rooms whilst basic are adequate, bathroom is tidy and clean and I really can't fault it. For a family of 3 it really did do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but a health hazard.. too many bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: dixie005
Reviews.Content: My husband and i booked in for one night only as we were in transit in Rome. What a terrible night we had. The next morning there was blood all over the sheets. We had been bitten by bed bugs. As a result i suffered an allergic reaction to the bed bugs and had to be treated in the emergency hospital in Norway (our next destination). When we complained to the General Manager the next day he apologised. Too late. I wish i had read the previous reviews first before making a reservation online.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old, bad maintained, rude and unprofessional staff. Broken A/C.”
Reviews.Author: OAIH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome last June and booked the Leonardi Fiamma ¿Hotel? We had a reservation for 3 nights and did only stay one night due to the following happenings. We were welcomed by a rude receptionist (General Manager of the hotel) who just said “Go for a walk and come back in two hours, the room is not ready”. It was 1:00 p.m. Two hours later, while we were waiting extra time for the room, the GM/receptionist tried to sell us different excursions to places like Vatican…he was pushing us a bit and also giving wrong information to force us to purchase the packages. I did not like it at all. When we finally got into the room, this had a very bad smell, the furniture was really, really old and the A/C was broken. I went to reception to ask, with friendly manners, if the A/C could be fixed as it was a very hot day in Rome and could not stay in a room like that. As it was Summer time in Rome!!!! The GM/receptionist kept going with the rudeness shown before and did call the head housekeeper who was even more rude and had no manners. She told me that they were aware of the failure in the A/C and that the following day would be fixed. I did not accept that answer and asked them for a room change. After several minutes making me feel like a trouble maker, she informed me that there were no more rooms in the hotel as all of them had been reserved for a group of American tourists. The head housekeeper also informed me that the group was very important for them since they were paying much more than me. Quote: “I cannot give you any other room reserved for the Americans because they pay more than you”. After 30 minutes of begging and humiliation, the head housekeeper and the GM/receptionist discussed something in Italian (I do not speak Italian but it is not difficult to be understood by Spanish speakers as myself). I understood something like “give him room number # so he will not want to move anymore”. I took the key and checked this new room. This room was very dark and small and when I opened the window, the wind brought to the room a lot dust and feathers from the pigeons outside. The window was facing an internal dirty and dark courtyard that was in reality a space full of rubbish. Obviously, I declined that room move and informed my local travel agency and the hotel my intentions to check out straight away. I was told by my agency that the hotel would charge for one night. Since it was already a bit late, I stayed that night in the hotel and left the following morning. Two months later, I am still waiting for the devolution of the two nights that I did not consume. The hotel has denied all these happenings and has invented their own version. See attached photos of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: vandop
Reviews.Content: For the reviews that I've seen here, I was some kind of scared, about I'd find when arrived in Rome. But for my surprise, I've passed a perfect 7 nights in the hotel, without any problem. The only cons that I can find, is about receptionist politeness, they are not rude, but they are not as polite as they could be, but its ok:P About cleanliness, nothing against, the room was clean and they change the towels every day. The breakfast is well served, although you shouldn't be waiting for an amazing breakfast, but for me was very fine, it depends on each one expectations. So, for what I've paid, I think that was quite nice and it surpassed my expectations. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “WARNING ! NOT CHOOSE FIAMMA HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Mary60_10
Reviews.Content: I was terrified in the morning when I saw all over the bed bugs. My husband is full of bites on the neck, hands and feets. We identified on net these bugs as "Cimex lectularius ",can transmit Hepatittis B, C and even HIV. This hotel should be closed urgently.

Reviews.Title: “Truly disappointing don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mariahpiper
Reviews.Content: I originally booked with Hotel Pavia, but when I arrived, they told me they're had been a mix up and to go to the hotel next door, Hotel Fiamma. The lobby is very misleading, just as the website is. It is by no means a 3 star, at least by my standards, and by my room. They put in two beds, when there is clearly barely room for one. It is extremely small, and I was the only person! The room was dusty. The beds were uncomfortable, I had to try out which one was the less uncomfortable one. The sheets were old and I was even afraid they had bed bugs. The sink and shower were clogged. Positive: Location (5 min walk to Termini). Don't stay here. It will ruin your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere. Not a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rambling_Rose_10
Reviews.Content: I booked one night in the Fiamma due to the location near the train station as we only needed an overnight stay and didn't want to go far with our bags. I wish I had read the reviews on here before I booked and changed hotels. This was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in so I would not recommend it. The hotel is very close to the main train station, and very easy to find. It was not noisy at night and we managed to get enough sleep. Those are the plus points, so it does do what is required. However if I had booked in for 2 nights, or had children, I would have gone straight out and found another hotel, never mind another room. I am not very fussy though, and told myself it was only for one night. But there are lots of hotels in Rome, and lots in this area, so I should have looked harder, I could have found a better room for less money. I was unhappy the whole time I was there and could not wait to leave. The staff on reception were short with us, not really rude, just not very forthcoming. We had to push them to find out about breakfast, and they wouldn't show us where the room was. We were given the very top room and told there was a couple of steps but in fact there was another flight of narrow stairs we had to carry our luggage up since the lift did not go that high. The room was large but dark and looked dirty, the windows did not close properly and the bathroom door kept opening by itself. The wardrobe would not close properly and the bedside table, desk and curtains looked like they might fall down if you touched them. There was no plug in the sink, which we needed. We couldn't close the bathroom window at all and we woke up cold in the night because of this. There were numerous things that made me realise there was no point in changing rooms, the problem was the whole atmosphere of the hotel. The walls were stained and the wallpaper was peeling. Fortunately the sheets on the bed were clean, so we went out and had something to eat, staying out as late as we could so we spent as little time as possible in the hotel. In the morning breakfast was a totally self-service affair, no sign of any staff at all. There was a coffee machine and the usual buffet but none of it was very good and the coffee was so bad I couldn't finish it. After we had eaten we saw a waitress stick her head around the corner of the room, then go back out again. At no point was anyone clearing tables or replenishing the buffet. (The last time I saw that sort of practice was when I got food poisoning from a hotel in Egypt so I do notice it now). I was less than impressed on all counts, all the other guests I saw looked either fed up or angry. This hotel fell far short of the standards we experienced in other Italian 3 star hotels, and I actually had to check the star rating on the way out. I can only imagine they do well because of their location and people not reading reviews such as the ones left on here. They certainly don't deserve repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rami19277
Reviews.Content: really when we road the reviews here we were scare a little but is the opposite what happen i recommend the hotel fiamma really a nice hotel bathrooms renewed well heated rooms(winter) and it has a good location near the central station of termini. the breakfast is correct you have an acceptable choice. the staff are freindly. dont hesitate if you go to rom to choose this hotel is good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room ever and terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: FlorCanada
Reviews.Content: The room was surprisingly small, pretty much only space for the bed, which was actually smaller than a double bed (for a couple). The service was even worse, people at the front desk were not friendly at all and I also witnessed an argument between the cleaners (mother and daughter) out loud in front of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: electronicopera
Reviews.Content: We arrived in at this hotel and I proceeded to speak in Italian to the man at the reception desk. He couldn't find my reservation and asked me for my ID. I showed him my Canadian passport and he says, " Oh Canadian" and begins speaking in English to me. He pulls out a map of Rome and then in the most uninterested voice I've ever heard he shows us where all the sights are, puts the key in front of me and tells me where my room is. All this time he is looking down, not smiling and not looking at me or my wife. After putting the key in front of me he turns away and continues doing things on his computer. My wife and I go to our room and it was like a closet. It was so small that we had to put one of our suitcases in the bathroom as there was no space in the room. The bathroom only had one towel so I went back down and asked (in Italian) if this was a double room as both the room and bed were very small and it only had one towel. He responded (rudely in English) that it was a double room and he'd get me another towel. A few minutes later he knocked on the door and pushed another towel at me and stormed off before I could even say thank you. The room itself was so dirty that I even had to wrap toilet paper around the remote control before I could use it. Oh, and I found two porno magazines in the room. The breakfast was OK but the orange juice looked like raspberry juice and tasted like nothing I've ever tasted before. The breakfast staff were rude and kept yelling at each other. Not a nice way to start your day. Overall not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rude dining room staff. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: paulinelindenburn
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent being near to buses, bus station and the crossing of the 2 metro lines. We changed our room after the first night as we (mother and daughter) were given a room which was far too small, with a double bed. Reception staff were reasonably helpful. Breakfast was adequate and continental, but staff should have replenished dishes more. Yoghurts and tomatoes would have been a welcome addition to the breakfast menu. Coffee from the hot drinks machine was already sugared, so I never had coffee as I do not take sugar. The hot drinks machine and juice machine were both turned off at 10 on the dot, and we found the 2 women who worked in the dining room were extremely rude, disobliging, surley and unhelpful. One of them actually shouted at us one day saying that we must leave as it was after 10 and they had other work to do! We still had not quite finished our breakfast, and were by no means late in arriving in the dining room. I did notice that if someone was male or Italian the waitresses were "all over them like a rash!" Would they have shouted at an Italian male?? The bedrooms were clean and comfortable. Towels were changed every day, and sheets changed more than once during the week. The bar never seemed to be open. It would have been nice to have a small outside area to sit in, but I suppose there was nowhere large enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fiamma is low quality service and condition hotel”
Reviews.Author: elkhan
Reviews.Content: Hello, I would like to inform and warn of staying in Fiamma hotel Roma,Italy because i was there from 27.12.2008 to 04.01.2009 and it was worst hotel i have ever used!!!!!!! First of all Fiamma hotel are offering old smelling rooms one of this room i was offered and it was located on ground floor after you entering through door you must go downstairs !!!! because room actually placed below ground level !!! Room was furnished very worn-out furniture and hard dampness smell was all over the room only one window was showing perfect view on the wall and if you keep it open for changing a air you will receive additional portiona of hard stink. I expressed my concern to reception and get other room on 3rd floor where currently were going some repair works and this room was such small that i was feeling that i am permanently in car so i have changed this room for room number 109 on first floor here just some problems that i discovered there: Bad smell Hot water shortage after 20:00 - 21:00 till morning Central heating was routinely cut off after 18:00 !!!! till 10:00 ( in winter time ) Some times they did not change towels. So service was awful. Thus i strongly advise to all tourists not to stay in Fiamma

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that forgets it is in the business of customer service”
Reviews.Author: trweinert
Reviews.Content: We got transferred to this hotel after the hotel we had a reservation to had a plumbing problem. From the beginning the staff was overall cold and unhelpful unless it involved them receiving money. On a warm weekend, the air conditioners for the entire building were turned off but we were not told that until after repeated calls to have someone fix ours. When asking for an extra blanket for our daughter, the hotel manager saw irony in our request and proceeded to talk bad about us in Italian with one of her employees while I standing right next to her. Little did she know I speak enough Italian to understand most conversations. If you're looking for a small room with a staff that is too busy to help their customers, you've come to the right place. (FYI, I'm far from having a negative personality)

Reviews.Title: “I love Rome”
Reviews.Author: SassySabby
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. It was close to the subway and within walking distance of other sites.It was not as clean as I prefer but after spending the previous week in Germany with out air conditioning I felt as if I was in heaven once I arrived here. The bed's mattress left a lot to be desired but that was not a deal breaker.I would return to this hotel simply because it really was easy to find and it was so quite and peaceful.The bar never opened not once during the entire trip.My sisters room which was more famly oriented and very different ,it consisted of three twin beds so remember this if you need to book a room with a child included.The staff was very pleasant and always had my key ready when I returned after my daily outings with out me having to provide my name and room number.They were the best part of this trip. The desk clerks on all three shifts spoke english if that is a concern.

Reviews.Title: “not the nicest hotel ive stayed in rome”
Reviews.Author: 3jays
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from this hotel,howver we did not book to stay here.we had originally booked into it's sister hotel along the street at the "Siviglia".I did not like the look of this hotel from the outside due to the grafitti daubed on it and chose the tried and trusted "Siviglia".when we arrived at the "Siviglia"we were told that they were fully booked,even though I had made the reservation in August!.The "Fiamma"is definately not as good as the "Siviglia"and was quite shabby.My sister's room was dingy and we would of complained and got moved to another "Leonardi"chain hotel but the location is ideal for the "Termini".The breakfast was average but the staff were quite friendly and helpful.Electric sockets were hanging off the walls but it was clean and comfortable.Definately not as nice as the "Siviglia"but I am annoyed about our booking.If I was returning to Rome I would stay at the "Impero"hotel which is not far from the "Termini"and is on Via Viminale.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: KJVLondon
Reviews.Content: Went with my partner for a romantic weekend in Rome. The city is absolutely amazing and we are very glad we went there however the hotel we were staying in gave us a bit of a stressful time. The room we were alocated to was ok, a bit smaller than we were expecting but we werent complaining until we opened the drink fridge: there was a half empty bottle of white wine and emty bottle of water. We took this to the reception and explained that it wasn't ours but they weren't very happy and were trying to charge us for it - of course we refused to pay. After spending the whole day in town and coming back completely exhausted we were told by the reception that there is no water in our room and somebody was coming to fix it - it was 11:45pm! We went back to our room and waited for about 30 minutes for somebody to come and sort our water problem but nobody did so we went back to the reception asking to be moved to a different room when only then we were told that the problem with water is actually in the every room... We asked if we could at least get a bottle of water to wash our face and hands but there was apparently no of that available either!!! It took a long time before they decided to give us 2 little bottles of water which were then added to our bill!!! Again we refused to pay. During breakfast there was always only one person serving tea and coffee so we never actually got it with our breakfast, long time after we finished... Do not ask reception to order you a taxi to the airport - they will tell you it will be 40 euros but you pay 60!!! Wish we have never booked this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “good for a budget holiday”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: this hotel good for the budget contious,we were welcomed warmly by the receptionist,the rooms were clean,if a little small,we had a disabled guest with us,the first few stairs were a bit difficult to negotiate but from there the lift got us to our floor,breakfast continental was good.and staff friendly.Also the hotel is close to the metro,and tour buses,overall we all thought the hotel adequate for our needs,

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Krissysk55
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I EVER stayed at! The room was tiny, the door handle to our room was broken, there was no heater in the room (or it was broken), and there was a huge hole in our wall! As for the bathrooms, the shower and sink were tiny, there was mold all over the shower, the towels had holes all over them, and there was NO HOT WATER!! It may not matter in the summer so much, but when the heater in the room is broken and you are traveling in the middle of January, it's COLD! ... Well, there was hot water for about 1 minute, then it shut off. We asked the people at the front desk if there is a problem with our room, and they informed us there were too many tourists and everyone is having the same problem and there is nothing they can do about it. Thanks a lot. I was ready to leave. The only plus is it is close to Termini. ...but I would rather walk 10 blocks farther than stay here!! This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at and I would not stay there again if someone paid me to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss”
Reviews.Author: EnglandFrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Took my husband to Rome for 5 days for his birthday as he had never been. The only thing in favour of the hotel is its location, which is near the main station, buses, metro etc. The surrounding area is perfectly safe. However. The room was not cleaned properly for the entire 5 days, there were electrical sockets hanging off the walls, the bathroom was dirty, the toilet started leaking half way through the trip and never stopped, the toilet paper was never replenished so we had to ration it, the television received one very crackly channel, the coffee at breakfast was foul and undrinkable, the bar was never open (and we really needed a drink), and the staff were largely indifferent to all this. The gang of young US students seemed to find it OK - perhaps you just have to be young.....?

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: guest12
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room over their official web site, we became a confirmation. When we came there in the evening, the employee in the reception was wery unkind and unprofessional. He just said: We are full, you must go to our another hotel 100m away. Of course, it was not a 100m away, but 1km.... and this is not the way they shoud threat the guests. We booked hotel Fiamma because of the location, if we would like to go to the other hotels, we would reservate another hotel. I asked the employee, if I could speak with the manager, but he said, that this is the way they do all the time and when they are full, they send guests away to fill their other hotels, which are not so good situated. He said also, that that's my problem, if I don't want to go to the other hotel... and he was very unkind. So we went to the hotel Siviglia. The air condition didn't work, the bath was small and dirty, it was full of hairs on the flour, they didn't clean the room and the bath at all. The room was in the ground flour, so we couldn't sleep because of the noise.... So, we will never go to Leonardi hotels again. This is not the way to threat the guests, the room in the other hotel Siviglia was dirty and they need to renovate this old and dirty hotel. For 150 euros per night you can find better hotels on better location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MikeP2K
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fiamma is located just a 2 minute walk from Termini station. They will offer you a pickup for the airport for around 50 euros. Save your money. There is a bus to Termini station from the airport for only 7 euros. I had read about this place being in a bad neighborhood in other reviews. I really didn't think it was horrible. No one approached us and I never felt unsafe walking the streets. Staying here is also a great location for using the metro to get to the Vatican museums and all the other attraction due to both main Rome metro lines joining at Termini station. The positives about the hotel were the location and the price. I only paid $130 a night. Not a bad price for being in one of the largest cities in the world. Breakfast was included. Not a bad breakfast either, no eggs or hot food but plenty of choices. The staff were okay as well. The front desk staff's English wasn't great but I can't fault them for that. Some of the negatives. We asked for a double room and we got it. We got two single beds pushed together with double sheets fitted over them. It didn't help that both mattresses sunk deeply in the middle. I had to sleep on the peak of the two mattresses to get a comfortable nights sleep. I wouldn't say that the room was dirty, but it wasn't immaculate either. The furniture in the room was extremely dated. Not quaint antique dated, just they need to buy some new furniture dated. All in all, I think I could probably find other hotels in Rome that would equal both price and quality. I'm not extremely opposed to staying here again, not hugely for it either.

Reviews.Title: “Good three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zarniw00p
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed three nights at Hotel Fiamma. The hotel is centrally located, 200m from the bad reputation Termini Station. We found the Station area safe (we used normal precautions; hidden wallet, tight grip on luggage). From Termini you can have a quick metro trip to Vatican City or Colosseo. We got 85€ per night discount price and for that price the hotel was a good deal. It is three star hotel, clean heated rooms with well equipped bathroom, nice breakfast and friendly staff. Shame that there was only one english tv channel: CNN. Safety box cost 3 € per night.

Reviews.Title: “nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to termini and only a bus or train ride to all major tourist attractions. staff are friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was average but filling. don't be put off by bad reviews, the hotel is ideal for those just wanting to visit the sites and have a good nights sleep. Dont go to the restaurant on the corner near traffic lights,ripp off and average food. There is a small supermarket near the hotel to buy drinks and other stuff and is much much cheaper than the ripp of street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Could do worse than the Fiamma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel to be perfectly adequate for the cost and our requirements. Breakfast was unlimited and of reasonable quality. There were instances where the decoration was suffering and could have been improved but generally the rooms were Ok, the bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was very good and the rooms were cleaned daily. Staff attitude was variable and depended heavily on who was manning reception. My main objection was that the hotel was on the edge of the main station area which is fine for getting to it but leaves you in a less than pleasant area particularly in the evenings. Restaurants and bars are few and far between in this area and you needed to walk at least 15 minutes to find something reasonable. Best restaurants we found were in Piaza Navon which is a 10 minute taxi ride away (costs about 12 Euro's). The train from Fuimincino airport and walk to the hotel is fine but would not recommend returning by the same route as the Termini platform is extremely crowded and boarding the train is difficult. Using the all day bus pass from the termini is a good way to get around which is a plus for how close it is to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable Hotel- no frills, central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked the Hotel Edera- one of the other hotels in the Leonardi chain. However on arriving at the Hotel Edera we were told that due to a problem with the hot water, they had moved us to the Fiamma, near the Termini. At first we were not happy as the Edera is closer to the Colusseum, and we had heard bad reports about the Termini area. On arriving at the Fiamma, there was a bit of grafitti on the adjoining building (VERY common in Rome) and also although the reception was clean and tidy it smelled a bit damp. However, when we got to our room, it was suprisingly nice. The room was spacious, had a big window and good air conditioning. The bathroom was very modern with a good shower. The sky TV was also great- MTV and CNN channels to keep you amused. Also there is a reasonably sized fridge in the room to keep chilled water and drinks. The hotel was also very quiet- and the breakfast in the morning was good. The location was not really a problem- literally a 2 min walk to the Termini Station. The colosseum is about a 10/15 minute walk and its a nice 30/40 minute stroll along to the Piazza Navona, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The Vatican City is quite far away, but you can get a metro from Termini to Basilica St Paul which is 2 mins away from the Vatican for 1 euro and it will take about 10 minutes. There is so many nice sights to look at though that you dont realise how far you have walked! One tip- taxis in Rome are a rip off- it cost us about £10 to travel the equivalent of a 5 minute walk. There are some good bars near to the hotel- at Piazza Dell Esquilino there is a great pub called Druids Rock- cheap pints in Happy hour which lasts till 10pm. Also the Fiddlers Elbow, Finnegans Wake and Marcionis are within 2 mins of Piazza Esquilino. Overall the hotel was perfectly acceptable. I wouldnt say it was 'seedy' like other reviews and we saw no trouble at all in the area. We booked through Expedia so it cost us about £60 a night- Dont pay any more than that though as it wouldnt be worth it. If you want to spend a bit more, I would advise to try and get a hotel nearer to the Piazza Navona- or on Via Veneto- a lovely street that is very central also. Football fans- dont bother going to Olympic Stadium to get a stadium tour, we went along and the guard was very rude and said the only time people were allowed in was during a football match.

Reviews.Title: “OK location - thats about all”
Reviews.Author: Slbazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fiamma in Jan 2004 - Location OK near termini station but a bit of a walk to main attractions. Room was pretty spacious but as per previous review, this hotel has a distinctly seedy quality. Staff were unhelpful - front desk staff generally uncommunicative & miserable. Breakfast average. Bathroom was a bit smelly & the toilet seat was cracked causing my husband to cut himself twice - most uncomfortable. Would not stay at Fiamma again nor recommend.
